build_analysis.description: Verify project can be built using specified build command

findings.message: pyproject.toml exists with proper [project] and [build-system] sections
Uses hatchling as build backend which is properly configured
Declares pygame-ce>=2.5.0 as dependency
appinfo.json specifies 'pygame' but pyproject.toml uses 'pygame-ce'. pygame-ce is a community edition fork of pygame and should be compatible.
Requires Python >=3.12 which is available in run scripts

startup_analysis.description: Verify main.py exists and can be executed with specified start command

findings.message: main.py exists with proper main() function and __name__ == '__main__' guard
main() function creates Game instance and calls run()
Imports pygame - matches dependency in pyproject.toml (pygame-ce provides pygame module)
All imports are from Python standard library (random, typing, enum, dataclasses)
Well-structured OOP design with Game, Player, Enemy, Elevator, Door, Bullet classes

game_specifications_compliance.description: Verify game matches specifications in appinfo.json

findings.message: Screen resolution matches specification (800x600)
Uses Pygame as specified (pygame-ce is compatible)
Keyboard input implemented with arrow keys, SPACE, Z, and ESC
Scoring constants match appinfo.json: 100 points per document, 50 per enemy, 1000 for escape
All specified entities implemented: Player, Elevator, Security Guard, Red Door, Blue Door, Escape Car
Win condition: Collect all red door documents and reach basement
Lose condition: Loss of 3 lives
Grid-based coordinates and entity velocity vectors implemented

code_quality_analysis.description: Basic code quality and potential issues

findings.message: Single-file architecture with good class organization
Type hints used consistently throughout codebase
Docstrings present for main classes (Enemy, Elevator, Player, Game)
All game constants defined at module level for easy configuration
Uses Enum for GameState and EntityType for better code clarity
Uses dataclass for Bullet and Door for clean data structures
Proper pygame initialization and display setup with error handling
Proper quit handling for both window close and ESC key
Screen bounds properly enforced for player position
Elevator request properly bounds-checked to valid floor range
Proper list iteration pattern (using [:] copy) when modifying bullets and particles during iteration
run.bat uses uv run with Python 3.12 as specified in appinfo.json
run.sh uses uv run with Python 3.12 as specified in appinfo.json
Both scripts use --no-active flag to avoid virtual environment conflicts

recommendations.message: Consider updating appinfo.json framework to specify 'pygame-ce' for accuracy
